title: PUBLIC Law, Chapter 190, An Act To Authorize the Board of Licensure of Podiatric Medicine and the State Board of Veterinary Medicine To Establish a Podiatrist Health Program and a Veterinarian Health Program
description: Effective 90 days following adjournment of the 125th Legislature, First Regular Session, unless otherwise indicated.
cleaned_text: An Act To Authorize the Board of Licensure of Podiatric Medicine and the State Board of Veterinary Medicine To Establish a Podiatrist Health Program and a Veterinarian Health Program Sec. 1. 24 MRSA §2502, sub-§1-A, as enacted by PL 1985, c. 804, §§3 and 22, is amended to read: Sec. 2. 24 MRSA §2502, sub-§1-C, as enacted by PL 1997, c. 697, §1, is amended to read: Sec. 3. 24 MRSA §2502, sub-§2, as amended by PL 1985, c. 804, §§4 and 22, is further amended to read: Sec. 4. 24 MRSA §2502, sub-§3, as enacted by PL 1977, c. 492, §3, is amended to read: Sec. 5. 24 MRSA §2502, sub-§4-A, as amended by PL 2009, c. 47, §1, is further amended to read: Sec. 6. 24 MRSA §2510, sub-§6, as amended by PL 1993, c. 600, Pt. B, §§21 and 22, is further amended to read: Sec. 7. 32 MRSA §3605-B, sub-§3, as enacted by PL 1993, c. 600, Pt. A, §239, is amended to read: Sec. 8. 32 MRSA §3605-B, sub-§7 is enacted to read: The board has the power to contract with other agencies, individuals, firms or associations for the conduct and operation of a podiatrist health program operated by a professional review committee. Sec. 9. 32 MRSA §4859, sub-§3, as amended by PL 2007, c. 402, Pt. R, §4, is further amended to read: Sec. 10. 32 MRSA §4859, sub-§6, as amended by PL 2007, c. 402, Pt. R, §4, is further amended to read: Sec. 11. 32 MRSA §4859, sub-§9 is enacted to read: The board has the power to contract with other agencies, individuals, firms or associations for the conduct and operation of a veterinarian health program operated by a professional review committee. Sec. 12. Appropriations and allocations. The following appropriations and allocations are made. PROFESSIONAL AND FINANCIAL REGULATION, DEPARTMENT OF Licensing and Enforcement 0352 Initiative: Allocates dedicated revenue funds for the State Board of Veterinary Medicine and the Board of Licensure of Podiatric Medicine to contract with an agency to operate a podiatrist health program and a veterinarian health program beginning in September 2011. |OTHER SPECIAL REVENUE FUNDS||2011-12||2012-13| | | All Other
